title: What are some of the interesting new developments in education technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: Whether or not to use new technologies in everyday school is no longer the issue. After all, the use of technology is part of the life of the new generations outside the classroom and, therefore, its application for the benefit of education can be considered an important way to increase the dynamism of the classes. In this context, what is important is how to integrate the new ways of teaching and learning to plan and the school curriculum. But to get there, how about knowing some of the benefits that these digital pedagogical tools offer, both for your lesson plan and for improving the performance of your students? We selected eight reasons, among benefits, advantages and curiosities about the use of technology in education. Check out! Know more about new developments in educational technology, visit this article .  Improve the quality of education by providing new avenues for teaching and learning as well as new methodologies, training educators and helping them discover innovative strategies for improving the educational process.Make classes more attractive and innovative: broadening possibilities for students and teachers and transforming learning, making it more motivating and meaningful.To contribute to the reduction of school dropouts and dropouts: by helping students with learning facilities or difficulties through personalized education, and by arousing their interest in studies.Increase integration and dialogue between students and teachers: encouraging self-confidence, affectivity, autonomy and socialization between teachers and students.Assist in improving student performance by extending the classroom beyond the school hours and environment, and by improving productivity in homework.Encourage students to learn and to teach: by increasing the dialogue with the family, at home, about the subjects seen in class.Awaken curiosity and new discoveries: stimulating new experiences through digital culture, building new skills and contributing to the development of children and adolescents.

According to Elon Musk, the problem with the current education system is that teachers teach the tools and not the problem. They will talk about 30 different types of screwdrivers that are available and the kids must memorise; but, if they were to describe the problem of how to get two things to hold together, the child would start thinking and would naturally become curious about the screwdriver. Likely, even end up learning about more tools available to get things to hold together due to their curiosity. I hope to one day help reverse the model on a national level, but for now, I created Einee - Talk to Einstein. One can talk to Einstein, Cleopatra, Leonardo Da Vinci and learn by simply talking. The app attempts to reverse the way education is fed. Play-first, education is second.
